result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon S Repinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 5/26/17....Length of probation corrected per letter from DOC dated 4/27/17.  Per Statue listed on letter probation ordered was to long.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Defendant Johnathon S Repinski in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF92, 16CM84.  Court instructs on conflicts with the DA, no conflict.   Agreement has been reached in all matters.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnarie/wiaver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC in amended Ct 2 in 16CF91, Ct 3 in 16CF92 and 16CM84-court will accept and find the DE guilty. Court will accept the recommendations of the parties. 

 DE will enter into a DAGP on Ct 1 in 16CF92, DE will enter a plea of NC, court will note but hold in abeyance for a three year period, DE will comply with all conditions of the DAGP, if successful Ct will be dismissed.  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 3-Withhold sentence 3 years probation, CC, DNA sample/surcharge.

16CF91-NC to amended Ct 2.  Ct 1 will be DRI.  Withhold sentence, 3 years probation, 45 days jail, credit for 8 days, commencing jail time 3-21-17, CC,DNA sample and surcharge.  17GF06 will be disposed of, any bond posted will apply to CC.  

16CM84-NC, withhold sentence, 3 years probation, CC, DNA sample/surcharge.
